intro: Lacistema leptostachyum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed lacistema, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
